Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:116: Surely, those who disbelieve, neither their wealth nor their children shall help them against Allah; and they are the people of the Fire. They shall be there forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:117: The example of what they spend in this worldly life is just like a wind that, having chill within, struck the tillage of those who wronged themselves, and destroyed it. Allah has not wronged them; rather, they did wrong to themselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:118: O you who believe, do not take anyone as an insider but those from among your own selves. They would spare no effort to do you mischief. They want you to be in trouble. Malice has come out of their mouths while what is concealed in their hearts is still worse. We have made the signs clear to you, if only you understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:119: Look, you are the ones who love them and they do not love you. You believe in all the books; (On the other hand,) when they meet you, they say, “We believe”, and when they are alone, they bite their finger-tips out of rage against you. Say, “May you perish in your rage.” Surely, Allah is All-Aware of what lies in the hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:120: If something good happens to you, it annoys them, and if something evil befalls you, they are delighted with it. If you keep patience and fear Allah, their cunning shall not harm you at all. Allah is All-Encompassing of what they do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:121: Recall the time when you left your house in the morning in order to place the believers in positions for fighting. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:122: When two of your groups were about to lose heart, while Allah was their guardian! It is in Allah alone that the believers must place their trust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:123: Allah certainly supported you at Badr when you were weak. So, fear Allah that you may be grateful
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:124: When you were saying to the believers, “Shall it not suffice you that your Lord should help you with three thousand of the angels sent down (for you)?”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:125: Of course, if you stay patient and fear Allah, and they come upon you even in this heat of theirs, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand of the angels, each having distinct marks.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:126: And Allah did this solely to make it a good news for you, and so that your hearts may be at rest with it. Otherwise, victory is from none but Allah, the All-Powerful, the All-Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:127: (Allah helped you) so that He may cut off a flank of disbelievers or throw them down in disgrace, and they go back frustrated.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:128: You have no authority in the matter, unless Allah forgives them or punishes them, as they are unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:129: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. He forgives whomsoever He wills and punishes whomsoever He wills. Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:130: O you who believe, do not eat up the amounts acquired through Ribā (interest), doubled and multiplied. Fear Allah, so that you may be successful,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:131: and fear the Fire that has been prepared for the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:132: Obey Allah and the Messenger, so that you may be blessed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:133: Race with one another towards Forgiveness from your Lord and towards a paradise the width of which spans the heavens and the earth. It has been prepared for the God-fearing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:134: -the ones who spend (for Allah’s sake) in prosperity and adversity, and those who control anger and forgive people. And Allah loves those who are good in their deeds,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:135: -and those who, when they happen to commit a shameful act or wrong themselves, remember Allah, then, seek forgiveness for their sins-and who is there to forgive sins except Allah?-and do not persist in what they have done, knowingly.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:136: Their reward is forgiveness from their Lord and gardens beneath which rivers flow where they shall live forever. And excellent is the reward of those who work.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:137: Many patterns of behavior have passed before you. So, traverse the land and see what was the fate of those who rejected (the prophets).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:138: This is a declaration for mankind, and guidance, and a lesson for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:139: Do not lose heart and do not grieve, and you are the upper-most if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:140: If you have received a wound, they have received a similar wound. Such days We rotate among the people, so that Allah may know those who believe and let some of you be martyrs - and Allah does not like the unjust
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:141: - and so that Allah may purify those who believe and eradicate the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:142: Do you think that you shall enter Paradise even before Allah knows those of you who carry out Jihād and those who are steadfast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:143: You had longed for death before you faced it. Now, you have seen it with your eyes wide open.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:144: MuHammad is but a messenger, there have been messengers before him. So, if he dies or is killed, would you turn back on your heels? Whoever turns back on his heels can never harm Allah in the least. Allah shall soon reward the grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:145: It is not the choice of a person to die without the will of Allah, death being a time-bound destiny. Whoever seeks a reward in this world, We shall give him out of it, and whoever seeks a reward in the Hereafter, We shall give him out of it. We shall soon reward the grateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:146: There have been many prophets with whom many men of Allah have fought; they did not lose heart for what they suffered in the way of Allah, nor did they become weak, nor did they yield. Allah loves the steadfast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:147: They had nothing else to say except that they said: “Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our conduct, make firm our feet and help us against the disbelieving people.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:148: So, Allah gave them the return in this world and also the better rewards in the Hereafter. Allah loves those who do good.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:149: O you who believe, if you obey those who disbelieve, they will make you turn back on your heels, then you shall turn into losers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:150: Instead, Allah is your Lord, and He is the best of all helpers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:151: We shall put awe into the hearts of those who disbelieve, since they have associated with Allah something for which He has not sent any authority. Their ultimate place is the Fire; and evil is the abode of the unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:152: Allah has surely fulfilled His promise to you when you, with His will, were killing them off, until you showed weakness and disputed in the matter and disobeyed after He had shown you what you liked.Among you there were some who were seeking the mundane, and among you there were others who were seeking the Hereafter. After that, He reversed your position against them, so that He may test you. Of course, He has forgiven you. Allah is All-Gracious to the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:153: When you were going away, not even turning to look at anyone, and the Messenger was calling you from behind you. He awarded you sorrow for sorrow, so that you should not grieve (in future) over what you lost, or for what you suffered. Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:154: Then, after the grief, He poured tranquility upon you - a drowsiness overtaking a group of you. Another group was worrying about their own selves, harboring thoughts about Allah that were untrue - thoughts of ignorance. They were saying, “Is there anything in our hands?” Say, “The whole thing belongs to Allah.” They conceal in their hearts what they do not disclose to you.They say, “If we had any say in the matter, we would not have been killed here.”Say, “If you were in your homes, those destined to be killed would have come out all the way to their (final) resting -places.” (All this was done) so that Allah may test your inner qualities and may purify what is in your hearts. Allah is All-Aware of what lies in the hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:155: Surely, those of you who turned back on the day when the two troops faced each other, Satan had but made them slip for some of their deeds. Of course, Allah has forgiven them. Certainly, Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very-Forbearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:156: O you who believe, do not be like those who disbelieved and said about their brethren while they travelled on the earth or had to fight, “Had they been with us, they would have not died, nor would they have been killed.” The result is that Allah makes it a remorse resting in their hearts. Allah gives life and brings death; Allah is watchful of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:157: If you are killed in the way of Allah or die, the forgiveness from Allah and the mercy is far better than what they accumulate
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:158: If you die or get killed, it is towards Allah that you shall be gathered.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:159: So, (O Prophet) it is through mercy from Allah that you are gentle to them. Had you been rough and hard-hearted, they would have dispersed from around you. So, pardon them, and seek Forgiveness for them. Consult them in the matter and, once you have taken a decision, place your trust in Allah. Surely, Allah loves those who place their trust in Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:160: If Allah helps you, there is none to overcome you. And if He abandons you, then, who is there to help you after that? In Allah the believers should place their trust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:161: It is not conceivable from a prophet to misappropriate the spoils. Whoever misappropriates shall bring forth, on Doomsday, what he misappropriated. Then, everybody shall be paid, in full, for what he has earned, and they shall not be wronged.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:162: How then, could one who submits to the pleasure of Allah be equal to him who returns with displeasure from Allah? His ultimate place is the Fire; and what an evil end it is!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:163: They are of various ranks with Allah. Allah is watchful of what they do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:164: Allah has surely conferred favor on the believers when He raised in their midst a messenger from among themselves who recites to them His verses and makes them pure and teaches them the Book and the Wisdom, while earlier, they were in open error.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:165: How is it that, when you suffered a hardship the twice of which you had inflicted upon them, you say, “Where did this come from?” Say, “This is from your own selves. Allah is surely Powerful over everything.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:166: Whatever you suffered on the day when the two troops faced each other was by the will of Allah, and in order to know the believers,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:167: and in order to know those who are hypocrites. It was said to them, “Come on, fight in the way of Allah, or defend.” They said, “Had we known it to be a fight we would have certainly followed you.” That day, they were nearer to disbelief than they were to Belief. They utter from their mouths what is not in their hearts. Allah knows well what they conceal.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:168: Those who said about their brethren, while themselves sitting, “Had they obeyed us, they would have not been killed.” Say, “Then avert death from yourselves if you are true.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:169: Never take those killed in the way of Allah as dead. Rather, they are alive with their Lord, well-provided,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:170: happy with what Allah has given them of His grace; and they feel pleased with the good news, about those left behind them who could not join them, that there shall be no fear for them nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:171: They feel pleased with blessing from Allah, and grace, and with the fact that Allah would not let the reward of the believers be lost.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:172: Those who responded to the call of Allah and the Messenger, even after they had received the wound, for those of them who did good deeds and feared Allah there is a great reward
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:173: - (that is) those to whom people said, “The people have gathered against you; so, fear them.” It increased them in Faith and they said, “Allah is fully sufficient for us, and the best One in whom to trust.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:174: So, they returned with bounty from Allah, and grace, with no evil having even touched them, and submitted to the pleasure of Allah. Allah is the Lord of great bounty.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:175: It is none but Satan who frightens (you) of his friends. So, do not fear them; but fear Me, if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:176: Those who hasten towards disbelief should not make you grieve. They cannot harm Allah at all. Allah intends not to spare for them any share in the Hereafter. For them there is a mighty punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:177: Certainly, those who bought disbelief in exchange for Belief cannot harm Allah at all. For them there is a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:178: Those who disbelieve should not think that the respite We give them is good for them. In fact, We give them respite only that they may increase in sin, and for them there is a humiliating punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:179: Allah is not to leave the believers in the state you are in, unless He separates the impure from the pure. Allah is not to inform you of the Unseen. But Allah selects from His messengers whom He wills. So, believe in Allah and His messengers. If you believe, and fear Allah, you will deserve a great reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:180: Those who withhold in miserliness what Allah has given them out of His grace should not take it as good for them. Instead, it is bad for them. They shall be forced, on the Doomsday, to put on what they withheld, as iron-collars round their necks. To Allah belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth. Allah is All-Aware of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:181: Allah has surely heard the words of those who said, “Allah is poor, and we are rich.”We shall write down what they said, and their killing of the prophets unjustly; and We shall say, “Taste the punishment of the flaming fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:182: This is due to what your hands sent ahead and that Allah is not cruel to His servants.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:183: (There are) those who have said, “Allah has directed us that we should not believe in a messenger unless he comes to us with an offering to be eaten up by the fire.”Say, “A number of messengers have come to you, before me, with clear signs and with what you have said. So, why did you kill them, if you are true?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:184: Then if they reject you, then messengers have been rejected before you. They came with clear signs and the Scriptures and the enlightening Book.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:185: Every soul has to taste death. It is on the Day of Judgement that you shall be paid your rewards in full. So, whoever has been kept away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise has really succeeded. The worldly life is nothing but an illusionary enjoyment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:186: Of course, you shall be tested in your wealth and yourselves; and, of course, you shall hear hurting statements from those who have been given the Book before you, and from those who associate (others with Allah in His divinity). If you observe patience and fear Allah, then this (observance) is among the matters of firm resolution.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:187: When Allah took a pledge from those who were given the Book: “You shall make it known to people, and you shall not conceal it,” they threw it away behind their backs, and acquired a small price for it. So, evil is what they acquire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:188: Do not think of those who are delighted with what they did, and love to be praised for what they never did - do not think they are secure from the punishment. For them there is a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:189: To Allah belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Allah is powerful to do every thing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:190: Surely, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for the people of wisdom,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:191: who remember Allah standing and sitting, and (lying) on their sides, and ponder on the creation of the heavens and the earth (and say) “Our Lord, You have not created all this in vain. We proclaim Your purity. So, save us from the punishment of Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:192: Our Lord, whomsoever You admit into the Fire, he is disgraced by You indeed, and for the unjust there are no supporters.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:193: Our Lord, We heard a herald calling towards Faith: ‘Believe in your Lord.’ So we believed.Our Lord, forgive us, then, our sins, and write off our evil deeds, and make us die only when we have joined the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:194: Our Lord, give us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and do not put us to disgrace on the Day of Judgement. Surely you do not go back on Your promise.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:195: So, their Lord answered their prayer: “I do not allow the labour of any worker from among you, male or female, to go to waste. You are similar to one another. So, those who emigrated, and were expelled from their homes, and were tortured in My way, and fought, and were killed, I shall certainly write off their evil deeds, and shall certainly admit them into gardens beneath which rivers flow, as a reward from Allah. It is Allah with Whom lies the beauty of the reward.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:196: The strutting of the disbelievers about the land should not deceive you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:197: It is just a little enjoyment. After that, their resort is Hell; and it is an evil abode.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:198: But those who fear their Lord, for them there are Gardens beneath which rivers flow, where they will live forever - as hospitality from Allah. What is with Allah is best for the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:199: Surely, among the people of the Book there are those who believe in Allah, and in what has been sent down to you and what has been sent down to them, humbling themselves before Allah. They do not barter away the verses of Allah for paltry (worldly) gains. They have their reward with their Lord. Surely, Allah is swift at reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 3:200: O you who believe, be patient, compete with each other in patience, and guard your frontiers and fear Allah, so that you may be successful.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:2: God! There is no god except Him, the Living, the Eternal.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:3: He has revealed to you the Book, by the truth, confirming what was before it, and He revealed the Torah and the Gospel
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:4: before, as guidance to people, and He revealed the Criterion. As for those who disbelieve in God's signs, for them awaits a terrible chastisement; God is Mighty, Lord of Retribution.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:5: Nothing whatever is hidden in heaven and earth from God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:6: He it is Who forms you in the wombs as He will. There is no god except Him, the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:7: He it is Who revealed to you the Book, wherein are verses [that are] clear, forming the Mother Book, and others allegorical. As for those in whose hearts is deviation, they follow the allegorical part, desiring sedition, and desiring its interpretation, and none knows its interpretation, save God. And those firmly rooted in knowledge say, 'We believe in it; all is from our Lord'; yet none remembers, but people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:8: Our Lord, do not cause our hearts to deviate after You have guided us; and give us mercy from You; You are the Bestower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:9: Our Lord, You shall gather mankind for a day of which there is no doubt; verily God will not fail the tryst.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:10: As for the disbelievers, neither their riches nor their children will avail them against God; those - they shall be fuel for the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:11: As the way of Pharaoh's folk, and the people before them, who denied Our signs; God seized them for their sins; God is severe in retribution.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:12: Say to the disbelievers: 'You shall be vanquished and mustered to Hell - an evil cradling!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:13: There has already been a sign for you in two hosts that met; one company fighting in the way of God; and another unbelieving; they saw them, twice the like of them; for God confirms with His help whom He will. Surely in that is a lesson for people of vision'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:14: Beautified for mankind is love of lusts - of women, children, stored-up heaps of gold and silver, horses of mark, cattle, and tillage. That is the comfort of the life of this world; but God - with Him is the more excellent abode.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:15: Say: 'Shall I tell you of something better than that? For those that are fearful with their Lord are Gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein, and spouses purified, and beatitude from God; and God is Seer, of His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:16: Those who say: “O, Our Lord, we believe; so forgive us our sins, and guard us from the chastisement of the Fire”,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:17: the patient, truthful, obedient, expenders, imploring God's pardon at daybreak'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:18: God bears witness that there is no god, except Him, and the angels, and those of knowledge; upholding justice; there is no god except Him, the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:19: Lo!, the religion with God is submission [to the One God]. Those who were given the Scripture, differed only after the knowledge came to them through transgression among themselves. And whoever disbelieves in God's signs, God is swift at reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:20: So if they dispute with you, say: 'I have surrendered my countenance to God and whoever follows me'; and say to those who have been given the Scripture, and to the uninstructed: 'Have you submitted?' And so if they have submitted, they have been guided, but if they turn their backs, your duty is only to deliver; and God sees His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:21: Those who disbelieve in the signs of God and slay the prophets without right, and slay those who enjoin to equity. So give them good tidings of a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:22: Those are the ones whose works have failed in this world and the Hereafter; they have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:23: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Book, being called to the Book of God, that it might decide between them, and then a party of them turned away, opposed?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:24: That, because they said, 'the Fire shall not touch us, except for a number of days'; and the lies they used to invent have deluded them in their religion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:25: But how will it be when We gather them for a day of which there is no doubt, and every soul shall be paid in full what is has earned, and they, shall not be wronged?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:26: Say: 'O God, Master of the Kingdom, you give the Kingdom to whom You will, and seize the Kingdom from whom You will; You exalt whom You will, and You abase whom You will; in Your hand is good. You are Able to do all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:27: You make the night to pass into the day and You make the day to pass into the night; You bring forth the living from the dead, and You bring forth the dead from the living, and You provide whom You will without reckoning'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:28: Let not the believers take the disbelievers as patrons, rather than the believers - for whoever does that, does not belong to God in anyway - unless you protect yourselves against them, as a safeguard. God warns you of His Self; and to God is the journey's end.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:29: Say: 'Whether you hide what is in your breasts, or disclose it, God knows it and knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth; and God is Able to do all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:30: The day every soul shall find what it has done of good present before it, and what it has done of evil, it will wish that between it and that there were a great distance. God warns you of His Self, and God is Kind to His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:31: Say: 'If you love God, follow me, and God will love you, and forgive you your sins; God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:32: Say: 'Obey God, and the Messenger'. But if they turn their backs, God loves not the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:33: Lo! God preferred Adam and Noah and the House of Abraham and the House of ‘Imrān above the worlds,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:34: the seed of one another; God is Hearer, Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:35: When the wife of ‘Imrān said, ‘Lord, I have vowed to You what is within my womb as a consecration. Accept this from me. Lo! It is You Who are the Hearer, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:36: And when she gave birth to her, she said, 'Lord, I have given birth to a female' - and God knew very well what she had given birth to the male is not as the female. 'And I have named her Mary, and commend her to You with her seed to protect them from the accursed Satan'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:37: Her Lord accepted the child with gracious acceptance, and made her grow excellently, and Zachariah took charge of her. Whenever Zachariah went into the sanctuary, where she was, he found her with provisions. 'O Mary', he said, 'Whence comes this to you?' She said, 'From God. Truly God provides for whomever He will without reckoning'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:38: Then Zachariah prayed to his Lord, saying, 'Lord, bestow upon me from You a goodly offspring, verily You are the Hearer of supplication'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:39: And the angels called to him, standing in the sanctuary at worship that 'God gives you good tidings of John, who shall confirm a Word from God; a lord, and one chaste, and a prophet of the righteous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:40: He said, 'My Lord! How shall I have a boy when old age has overtaken me, and my wife is barren?' He said, 'So it will be'. 'God does what He will'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:41: He said, 'My Lord! Appoint for me a sign'. He said, 'Your sign is that you shall not speak to men, save by tokens for three days. And remember your Lord often, and glorify [Him] at evening and dawn'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:42: And when the angels said, 'O Mary, God has preferred you, and made you pure; He has preferred you above all women of the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:43: O Mary, be obedient to your Lord, prostrating and bowing with those who bow'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:44: That is of the tidings of the Unseen. We reveal it to you for you were not with them, when they were casting quills, which of them should have charge of Mary; nor were you with them, when they were disputing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:45: When the angels said, 'O Mary, God gives you good tidings of a Word from Him, whose name is the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, honoured shall he be in this world, and the Hereafter, and of those brought close.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:46: He shall speak to mankind in the cradle, and in his manhood, and he is of the righteous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:47: She said, 'Lord, how shall I have a child when no mortal has touched me?' He said, 'It is such. God creates what He will. When He decrees a thing, He says to it only: “Be”, and it is'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:48: And He will teach him the Book, wisdom, and the Torah, and the Gospel.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:49: To be a messenger to the Children of Israel, 'I have come to you with a sign from your Lord, I will create for you out of clay like the shape of a bird then I will breathe into it, and it will be a bird by the leave of God. I will also heal the blind and the leper; and I bring to life the dead, by the leave of God. I will inform you too of what things you eat, and what you treasure up in your houses. Surely in that is a sign for you, if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:50: Likewise, confirming that which was before me of the Torah, and to make lawful for you some of that which was forbidden to you. I have come to you with a sign from your Lord: so fear God, and obey me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:51: Surely God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:52: And when Jesus sensed their disbelief, he said, 'Who will be my helpers unto God?' The disciples said, 'We will be helpers of God; we believe in God; witness that we have submitted.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:53: Lord, we believe in what You have revealed, and we follow the Messenger; inscribe us therefore with those who bear witness’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:54: And they schemed; and God schemed; and God is the best of schemers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:55: When God said, 'O Jesus, I am gathering you, and raising you to Me, and I am cleansing you of those who disbelieved, and I am setting those who follow you above those who disbelieved until the Day of Resurrection. Then to Me shall be your return, and I will decide between you, as to what you were at variance about.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:56: As for the disbelievers, I will chastise them with a terrible chastisement in this world and the Hereafter; they shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:57: But as for the believers, who do deeds of righteous, He will pay them in full their wages. God loves not the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:58: This We recite to you of verses and wise remembrance.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:59: Truly, the likeness of Jesus in God's sight, is as Adam's likeness. He created him of dust, then said He to him, 'Be', and he was.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:60: The truth is from your Lord; be not of those who waver.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:61: And whoever disputes with you concerning him, after the knowledge that has come to you, say: 'Come! Let us call our sons and your sons, our wives and your wives, our selves and your selves, then let us humbly pray and invoke God's curse upon those who lie'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:62: This is the true story. There is no god but God, and assuredly God is Mighty, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:63: And if they turn their backs, God knows the agents of corruption.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:64: Say: 'O People of the Scripture! Come now to a word agreed upon between us and you, that we worship none but God and that we do not associate anything with Him, and do not take each other for lords, beside God'; and if they turn their backs, say, 'Bear witness that we have submitted'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:65: O People of the Scripture! Why do you argue about Abraham?, when the Torah was not revealed, neither the Gospel, but, after him. What, do you not comprehend?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:66: Lo! You are those who dispute about what you know: why do you then dispute concerning that of which you have no knowledge?; and God knows, and you know not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:67: No; Abraham in truth was not a Jew, neither a Christian, but he was a Muslim and a hanīf, and he was never of the idolaters.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:68: Surely the people with the best claim, Abraham, are those who followed him, and this Prophet, and those who believe; and God is the Protector of the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:69: There is a party of the People of the Scripture who yearn to make you go astray; yet they cause none to stray, except themselves; but they are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:70: O People of the Scripture! Why do you disbelieve in God's verses, when you yourselves bear witness?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:71: O People of the Scripture! Why do you confound truth with falsehood, and conceal the truth while you know?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:72: A party of the People of the Scripture say, 'Believe in what has been revealed to those who believe at the beginning of the day, and disbelieve at the end of it, so that they might then turn back.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:73: And do not believe except in one who follows your religion'. Say: 'True guidance is God's guidance - that anyone should be given the like of what you have been given, or that they should dispute with you before your Lord'. Say: 'Surely bounty is in God's Hand; He gives it to whomever He will; God is Embracing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:74: He singles out for His mercy whom He will; God is of bounty abounding'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:75: And of the People of the Scripture is he who, if you trust him with a hundredweight, he will return it to you; and of them is he who, if you trust him with one dinar, will not return it to you; unless you keep standing over him. That is because they say, 'We have no duty towards the Gentiles. They speak falsehood against God, while they are aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:76: Nay, but whoever fulfils his covenant, and has fear, for truly God loves the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:77: Those that sell God's covenant and their own oaths for a small price, there shall be no share for them in the Hereafter; and God shall not speak to them, nor look upon them on the Day of Resurrection, nor will He purify them and theirs will be a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:78: And there is a group of them who twist their tongues with the Book, so that you may suppose it as part of the Book; yet it is not part of the Book; and they say, 'It is from God', yet it is not from God, and they speak falsehood against God, while they know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:79: It belongs not to any mortal that God should give him the Book, the Judgement, prophethood, then that he should say to men, 'Be servants to me instead of God'. Rather, 'Be masters, by virtue of what you know of the Book and in what you study'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:80: He would never order you to take the angels and the prophets as lords. Would He order you to disbelieve, after you have submitted?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:81: And when God made a covenant with the prophets: 'What I have given you of the Book and wisdom; then there shall come to you a messenger confirming what is with you - you shall believe in him and you shall help him'. He said to them, 'Do you affirm? And do you take My load on you on that condition?' They said, 'We affirm'. He said, 'Then bear witness, and I shall be with you among the witnesses'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:82: Then whoever turns his back after that, they are the wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:83: What! Do they desire other than God's religion, when to Him has submitted, whoever is in the heavens and the earth, willingly, or unwillingly, and to Him they shall be returned?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:84: Say, 'We believe in God, and that which has been revealed to us, and that which has been revealed to Abraham and Ishmael, and Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes; and in that which was given to Moses and Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord; we make no division between any of them; and to Him we submit'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:85: Whoever desires a religion other than Islam, it shall not be accepted from him and in the Hereafter he shall be among the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:86: How shall God guide a people who have disbelieved after their belief, and bore witness that the Messenger is true, and after the clear signs had come to them? God guides not the evildoing folk.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:87: Those - their requital is that there shall rest on them the curse of God and of the angels and of men altogether.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:88: Abiding therein, the chastisement shall not be lightened for them and they shall not be reprieved.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:89: But those who repent thereafter, and make amends, then truly God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:90: Surely those who disbelieve after they have believed, and then increase in unbelief, their repentance shall not be accepted; those are the ones who go astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:91: Surely those who disbelieve, and die disbelieving, the whole earth full of gold shall not be accepted from any one of them if he would ransom himself thereby; for them awaits a painful chastisement, and they shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:92: You will not attain piety until you expend of what you love; and whatever thing you expend, God knows of it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:93: All food was lawful to the Children of Israel save what Israel forbade for himself before the Torah was revealed. Say: 'Bring the Torah now, and recite it, if you are truthful'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:94: Whoever invents falsehood against God after that, those are the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:95: Say: ‘God has spoken the truth, therefore follow the creed of Abraham, a hanīf, and he was not an idolater’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:96: The first house established for the people was that at Bakka, a blessed place, and a guidance to all worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:97: Therein are clear signs, the station of Abraham; and whoever enters it is in security. It is the duty of people towards God to make the pilgrimage to the House, if he is able to make his way there. As for the one who disbelieves, God is Independent of all worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:98: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, why do you disbelieve in God's verses, when God is Witness of what you do?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:99: Say: 'O People of the Scripture, why do you bar believers from God's way, desiring to make it crooked, while you yourselves are witnesses. God is not heedless of what you do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:100: O you who believe, if you obey a party of those who have been given the Scripture, they will turn you, after you have believed, into disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:101: How can you disbelieve while you have God's verses recited to you, and His Messenger is in your midst? Whoever holds fast to God, he is guided to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:102: O you who believe, fear God as He should be feared; and do not die, except as Muslims.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:103: And hold fast to God's bond, together, and do not scatter; remember God's grace upon you when you were enemies, and He brought your hearts together so that by His grace you became brothers; and you were upon the brink of a pit of fire; but He delivered you from it. So God makes clear to you His signs that you might be guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:104: Let there be one community of you calling to good, and enjoining decency, and forbidding indecency; those are the successful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:105: Be not as those who scattered and disputed after the clear proofs came to them, those there awaits a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:106: The day when some faces are blackened, and some faces whitened. As for those whose faces are blackened, 'Did you disbelieve after you had believed? Then taste the chastisement for what you disbelieved!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:107: But as for those whose faces are whitened, they shall be in God's mercy, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:108: Those are the verses of God which We recite to you in truth, and God desires not any injustice for the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:109: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and in the earth, and to Him all matters are returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:110: You are the best community brought forth to men, enjoining decency, and forbidding indecency, and believing in God. Had the People of the Scripture believed, it would have been better for them; some of them are believers; but most of them are wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:111: They will not harm you, except a little hurt; and if they fight against you, they will turn their backs to you, then they will not be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:112: Abasement shall be cast upon them, wherever they are found, save a rope of God, and a rope of the people; they have incurred with anger from God, and poverty shall be cast upon them; that because they disbelieved in God's signs, and slew the prophets without right; that because they disobeyed and used to transgress.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:113: Yet they are not all alike; some of the People of the Scripture are a community upright, who recite God's verses in the watches of the night, prostrating themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:114: They believe in God and in the Last Day, enjoining decency and forbidding indecency, vying with one another in good works; those are of the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:115: And whatever good they do, they shall not be denied it, and God knows the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:116: As for the disbelievers, their riches shall not avail them, neither their children, against God; those are the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:117: The likeness of what they expend in the life of this world is as the likeness of a wind wherein is a blast that smote the tillage of a people who have wronged themselves and destroyed it. God did not wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:118: O you who believe, do not take as intimates anyone apart from yourselves; such men spare nothing to ruin you; they would love for you to suffer. Hatred is revealed by their mouths; and what their breasts conceal is yet greater. Now We have made clear to you the signs; if you understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:119: Lo, there you are, you love them, but they love you not; you believe in the Book, all of it, and when they meet you they say, 'We believe', but when they are alone, they bite at you their fingertips, in rage. Say: 'Perish in your rage. God knows what is in the breasts'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:120: If good fortune befalls you, it is evil for them; but if evil, befalls you, they rejoice thereat. Yet if you endure and fear, their guile will not hurt you at all; God encompasses what they do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:121: And when you went forth at dawn from your family to assign the believers their places for battle, and God hears, knows.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:122: When two parties of you were about to lose heart; and God was their Protector, and let the believers rely on God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:123: God already gave you victory at Badr, when you were contemptible. So fear God, in order that you might be thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:124: When you were saying to the believers, 'Is it not sufficient for you that your Lord should reinforce you with three thousand angels sent down?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:125: Yea, if you are patient and fear, and they come against you instantly, your Lord will reinforce you with five thousand angels accoutred'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:126: What God ordained was only as a good tiding to you and that your hearts might be at peace. Victory comes only from God, the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:127: And that He might cut off a party of the disbelievers, or suppress them, so that they fall back, frustrated.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:128: It is no concern at all of yours, whether He relents to them or chastises them; for they are indeed evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:129: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; He forgives whom He wills and chastises whom He wills. And God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:130: O you who believe, do not exact usury, twofold and severalfold. And fear God, so that you may prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:131: And fear the Fire that has been prepared for the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:132: And obey God and the Messenger, so that you may find mercy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:133: And vie with one another hastening to forgiveness from your Lord, and to a garden as wide as the heavens and the earth that has been prepared for those who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:134: Who expend in prosperity and adversity, and restrain their rage, and pardon their fellow-men; and God loves those who are virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:135: And who when they commit an indecency or wrong themselves, remember God, and pray forgiveness for their sins - and who shall forgive sins but God? - and who do not persist in what they did, knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:136: Those - their requital is forgiveness from their Lord, and Gardens beneath which rivers flow, abiding therein; excellent is the wage of those workers!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:137: Ways of life have passed away before you; so travel in the land and behold how was the end of those who denied.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:138: This is an exposition for mankind, and a guidance, and an admonition for such as are God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:139: Faint not, neither grieve, for you shall prevail if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:140: If a wound touches you, a like wound already has touched the other people. Such days We deal out in turn among mankind, and that God may know those who believe; and that He may take witnesses from among you, and God loves not the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:141: And that God may prove the believers, and efface the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:142: Or did you suppose you should enter Paradise without God knowing, who among you have struggled and who are patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:143: You were longing for death before you met it. Now you have seen it, looking on.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:144: Muhammad is only a messenger; messengers have passed away before him. Why, if he should die or is slain, will you turn back on your heels. If any man should turn back on his heels, he will not harm God in any way, and God will requite those that are thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:145: It is not for any soul to die, save by the leave of God, a prescribed term. And whoever desires the reward of this world, We will give him of it; and whoever desires the reward of the Hereafter, We will give him of it; and We will requite the thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:146: How many a prophet has been killed and with him thousands manifold [fought], but they fainted not in the face of what afflicted them in God's way; they neither weakened, nor did they humble themselves. And God loves the patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:147: All that they said was, 'Our Lord, forgive us our sins and our excesses in our affairs and make firm our feet and help us against the unbelieving folk'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:148: And God gave them the reward of this world, and the fairest reward of the Hereafter, and God loves the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:149: O you who believe, if you obey the disbelievers, they will make you turn back on your heels, and you will revert as losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:150: Nay, but God is your Protector, and He is the best of helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:151: We will cast terror into the hearts of the disbelievers; for what they have associated with God that for which He has revealed no warrant; their abode shall be the Fire; evil is the abode of the evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:152: God has been true to His promise, when you were slew them by His leave, until you lost heart, and quarrelled over the command; and you disobeyed after He had shown you what you longed for. Some of you desired this world; and some of you desired the Hereafter. Then He turned you away from them, so that He might try you; yet now He has pardoned you, and God is Bounteous to the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:153: When you were ascending, not turning around for anyone and the Messenger was calling you from your rear, so He rewarded you with grief for grief so that you might not grieve for what escaped you, neither for what befell you; and God is aware of what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:154: Then He sent down upon you, after grief, security - a slumber overcoming a party of you, and a party whose own souls distressed them, thinking wrongly of God, thoughts of age of ignorance, saying, ’Have we any part whatever in the affair?’ Say: ’The affair belongs entirely to God’. They conceal within their hearts what they do not disclose to you, saying, ’Had we had any part in the affair, we would not have been slain here’. Say: ’Even if you had been in your houses, those for whom it had been appointed that they be slain would have sallied forth to the places where they were to lie’ that God might try what was in your breasts and that He might prove what was in your hearts; and God knows what is in the breasts.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:155: Truly, those of you who turned away the day the two hosts encountered each other - truly, Satan made them slip through some of what they had earned; but God pardoned them; God is Forgiving, Forbearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:156: O you who believe, be not as the disbelievers, who say of their brothers, when they travel in the land, or are on raiding campaigns, 'Had they been with us, they would not have died and would not have been slain' - so that God may make that anguish in their hearts. For God gives life, and He gives death and God sees what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:157: And if you are slain in God’s way, or die, forgiveness from God and mercy are better than what they amass.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:158: And if you die or are slain, it is to God you shall be mustered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:159: It was by the mercy of God that you were lenient with them; had you been harsh and fierce of heart, they would have dispersed from about you. So pardon them, and ask forgiveness for them, and consult them in the matter. And when you are resolved, rely on God; for God loves those who rely.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:160: If God helps you, then none can overcome you; but if He forsakes you, then who is there who can help you after Him? Therefore on God let the believers rely.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:161: It is not for a prophet to be fraudulent; whoever defrauds shall bring what he has defrauded on the Day of Resurrection; then every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned, and they shall not be wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:162: Is he who follows God's beatitude like him who is laden with God's anger, whose abode is Hell? An evil journey's end!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:163: They are of degrees before God; and God sees what they do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:164: Truly God was gracious to the believers when He sent to them a messenger from among their own to recite to them His verses, and to purify them, and to teach them the Book, wisdom, though before, they were in clear error.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:165: And why, when distress befell you, and you had afflicted twice the like of it, did you say, 'How is this?' Say: 'It is from yourselves. Surely God has power over everything'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:166: And what afflicted you, the day the two hosts encountered, was by God's leave, and that He might know the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:167: And that He might also know the hypocrites when it was said to them, 'Come now, fight in the way of God or defend', they said, 'If we knew how to fight we would follow you'. They that day were nearer to unbelief than to belief, saying with their mouths that which was not in their hearts. And God knows best what they hide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:168: Those who said to their brothers, whilst they themselves stayed put, 'Had they obeyed us, they would not have been slain'. Say: 'Then avert death from yourselves, if you speak the truth'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:169: Count not those who were slain in God's way, as dead, but rather, living with their Lord, provided for [by Him].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:170: Rejoicing in what God has given them of His bounty, and rejoicing, for the sake of those who have not joined them but are left behind, that no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:171: Joyful in grace and bounty from God, and that God does not let the wage of believers go to waste.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:172: [For] those who responded to God and the Messenger after the wounds had afflicted them, and feared, shall be a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:173: Those to whom people said, 'The people have gathered against you, therefore fear them'; but that increased them in faith, and they said, 'God is sufficient for us, an excellent Guardian is He'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:174: So they returned with grace and bounty from God, and no evil touched them, and they followed the beatitude of God; and God is of bounty abounding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:175: That is only Satan making fear his friends, therefore do not fear them; but fear Me, if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:176: Let them not grieve you those that vie with one another in unbelief; they will not hurt God at all. God desires not to assign them any portion in the Hereafter, and theirs is a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:177: Those who purchase unbelief at the price of faith, they will not hurt God at all, and there awaits them a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:178: And let not the disbelievers suppose that what We indulge them in is better for their souls. We grant them indulgence only that they may increase in sinfulness, and theirs is a humbling chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:179: It is not God's purpose to leave the believers in the state in which you are till He shall distinguish the evil one from the good. And it is not God's purpose to apprise you of the Unseen, but God chooses of His messengers whom He will. So believe in God and His messengers; and if you believe and guard [against evil], then yours shall be a great wage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:180: Let them not suppose those who are niggardly with what God has given them of His bounty, that it is better for them; nay, it is worse for them; what they were niggardly with, they shall have hung around their necks on the Day of Resurrection; and to God belongs the inheritance of the heavens and the earth. And God is aware of what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:181: Verily God has heard the saying of those who said, 'Indeed God is poor, and we are rich'. We shall write down what they have said and their slaying the prophets without right, and We shall say, 'Taste the chastisement of the Burning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:182: That is for what your hands have sent before; for God is never unjust towards His servants'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:183: Those same who said, 'God has already made covenant with us that we should not believe in any messenger until he bring us an offering to be devoured by fire': 'messengers have come to you before me with clear proofs, and with that which you said. Why did you slay them, then, if you are truthful?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:184: But if they deny you, so were denied messengers before you who came bearing clear proofs, and the Scriptures, and the Illuminating Book.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:185: Every soul shall taste of death; you shall surely be paid in full your wages on the Day of Resurrection. Whoever is moved away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, will have triumphed, the life of this world is but the comfort of delusion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:186: You shall surely be tried in your property; and in your selves, and you shall hear from those who were given the Scripture before you, and from those who are idolaters, much hurt, but if you are patient, and fear - surely that is true resolve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:187: And when God made covenant with those who had been given the Scripture, 'You shall expound it to people, and not conceal it'. But they rejected it behind their backs, and bought with it a small price; how evil is what they have bought!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:188: Do not reckon that those who rejoice in what they have brought, and who love to be praised for what they have not done - do not reckon them secure from the chastisement; there shall be a painful chastisement for them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:189: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and of the earth, and God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:190: Surely in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of night and day, there are signs for people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:191: Those who remember God, standing and sitting and on their sides, and reflect upon the creation of the heavens and the earth: 'Our Lord, You have not created this in vain. Glory be to You! So guard us against the chastisement of the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:192: Our Lord, whomever You admit into the Fire, You will have abased, and the evildoers shall have no helpers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:193: Our Lord, we have heard a caller calling to belief, saying, "Believe in your Lord!" And we believed. So, our Lord, forgive us our sins and absolve us of, our evil deeds, and take us [in death] with the pious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:194: Our Lord, grant us what You have promised us through Your messengers, and abase us not on the Day of Resurrection. You will not fail the tryst'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:195: And their Lord answers them, ’I do not let the labour of any labourer among you go to waste, be you male or female - the one of you is as the other: and those who emigrated, and were expelled from their habitations, those who suffered hurt in My way, and fought, and were slain - them I shall surely absolve of their evil deeds, and I shall admit them to Gardens underneath which river flow’. A reward from God! And God - with Him is the fairest reward.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:196: Let it not delude you, that the disbelievers go to and fro in the land,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:197: a little enjoyment; then their abode is Hell - an evil cradling!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:198: But those who fear their Lord - for them shall be Gardens underneath which rivers flow, abiding therein; a hospitality from God Himself. That which is with God is better for the pious.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:199: Verily, there are some among the People of the Scripture who believe in God, and what has been revealed to you, and what has been revealed to them, humble before God, not purchasing with the verses of God a small price. Those - their wage is with their Lord. God is swift at reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 3:200: O you who believe, be patient and vie in patience, be steadfast; fear God so that you will prosper.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:1: Alif, Lam, Mim. (Only Allah and the Messenger [blessings and peace be upon him] know the real meaning.)
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:2: Allah! None is worthy of worship but He, the Ever-Living, Self-Subsisting and Sustainer (of the entire universe with His Strategy).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:3: (O Beloved!) He is the One Who has revealed to you (this) Book with truth. (It) confirms (all those Books) that were revealed before it. And He is the One Who has revealed the Torah and the Injil (the Gospel).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:4: (As the Books were revealed) before this to guide the people, He has (now, in like manner,) revealed (the Qur’an,) the criterion to distinguish right from wrong. Verily, those who deny Allah’s Revelations, for them is rigorous punishment. And Allah is Almighty, the Lord of Retribution.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:5: Surely, nothing is hidden from Allah in the earth or in the heaven.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:6: He is the One Who shapes your forms the way He wills in the wombs (of mothers). None is worthy of worship but He. He is Almighty, All-Wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:7: He is the One Who has revealed to you the Book comprising some firm and solid Verses (i.e., literally clear and precise in meaning); they are the foundation of (the commandments) of the Book. And other Verses are figurative (i.e., containing abstract and allusive meaning). So, those who have deviation in their hearts follow only its figurative Verses (just) under the urge to create disruption and with the motive to supply them self-seeking interpretation instead of their true interpretation. But none knows its true interpretation apart from Allah. And those who are perfectly firm in knowledge say: ‘We believe in it. The whole (Book) has been revealed by our Lord.’ And direction and guidance is the share of only those who possess wisdom and insight.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:8: (And they submit:) ‘O our Lord, let not our hearts deviate after You have honoured us with guidance, and grant us mercy especially from Your presence. Truly, You alone are the Great Bestower.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:9: O our Lord! You will surely bring together mankind on the Day about which there is no doubt. Verily, Allah does not go against (His) promise.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:10: Indeed, those who reject faith, neither their wealth nor their children shall be able to save them anyway from (the torment of) Allah. It is they who are the fuel of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:11: (Their) line of action (also) resembles that of the people of Pharaoh and those before them who belied Our Revelations. So, Allah seized them because of their sins and Allah gives severe punishment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:12: Say to the disbelievers: ‘You will soon be overpowered and driven towards Hell, and that is a very evil abode.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:13: There is certainly a sign for you in the two parties that encountered each other (in the battlefield of Badr)—one party (i.e., the Muslims) fought (a defensive war) in the cause of Allah, and the other comprised the disbelievers (i.e., the Meccan aggressors who invaded the peaceful Muslims of Medina). They saw them with their (own) eyes as twice their own number. And Allah provides strength with His reinforcement to whom He wills. In this incident, there is surely a (notable) lesson of warning for those who have eyes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:14: (Excessively) attractive has been made, for the people, the love of lusts (that) include women, children, and hoarded treasures of gold and silver, and branded horses and cattle and crops. (All) this is the provision of the worldly life and with Allah is the best abode.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:15: (O Beloved!) Say: ‘Shall I give you the news of something far better than all this? (Yes,) for the Godfearing there are (such) Gardens with their Lord beneath which streams flow. They will live there forever. There will be (for them) chaste wives, and (above all) they shall enjoy the pleasure of Allah.’ And Allah monitors His servants well.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:16: (These are the people) who say: ‘O our Lord, we have surely believed, so, forgive us our sins and save us from the torment of Hell.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:17: (They are) steadfast (people), truthful in their words and deeds and submissive in devotion and obedience. And they spend in the way of Allah, and (rise) in the later hours of the night to implore Allah’s pardon.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:18: Allah bears witness that none is worthy of worship apart from Him; and the angels and those who possess knowledge also bear testimony to it (as well as the fact) that He designs and executes every plan with justice. None is worthy of worship but He. He is Almighty, All-Wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:19: Truly, Islam is the only Din (Religion) in Allah’s sight. And the People of the Book disagreed, after knowledge had come to them, only on account of their mutual jealousy and contention. And he who denies Allah’s revelations, then surely Allah hastens in calling to account.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:20: (O Beloved!) If they, even then, dispute with you, say to them: ‘I have bowed my humble face in absolute submissiveness before the presence of Allah and so have those who follow me.’ And say to the People of the Book as well as the illiterate ones: ‘Do you also bow before Allah absolutely (i.e., do you accept Islam)?’ And, if they embrace submission, then they have truly achieved guidance. But if they turn away, your responsibility is only to deliver the command. And Allah is Watchful of His servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:21: Certainly, those who deny the Revelations of Allah and kill the Prophets unjustly, and also kill those of the people who enjoin equity and justice, announce to them the news of a grievous torment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:22: They are the ones whose works have become void both in this world and in the Hereafter. And they shall have no helpers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:23: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of (the knowledge of) the Book? They are invited towards the Book of Allah, so that it (the Book) gives judgment (on disputes) amongst them. Then, a party of them turn away and it is they who deviate.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:24: This (courage to deviate) is because they say: ‘The Fire of Hell will not touch us except for a few numbered days.’ And the lies that they invent (about Allah) have deluded them with regard to their din (religion).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:25: So, what will be their plight when We shall assemble all of them together on the Day in (the happening of) which there is no doubt, and everyone will be paid back in full for whatever (deeds) he has earned, and no injustice will be done to them?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:26: (O My Beloved!) Submit (like this): ‘O Allah, Lord of sovereignty! You bestow sovereignty on whom You will, and You take away sovereignty from whom You will. You confer honour on whom You will, and You dishonour whom You will. All good is in Your Mighty Hand. Surely, You have absolute authority and control over everything.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:27: You make the night enter into the day, and You make the day enter into the night; and You bring the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living; and You bless (with Your bounties) without measure whom You wish.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:28: The Muslims should not make friends with disbelievers instead of Muslims. And whoever does so will have nothing of (the alliance with) Allah except that you seek protection (from their mischief). And Allah warns you to fear (the wrath) of His divine essence, and to Allah is the return.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:29: Say: ‘Whether you hide what is in your breasts or make it known, Allah knows it, and He thoroughly knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth. And Allah has mighty control over everything.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:30: On the Day when every soul shall find present (before him) every good that he accomplished and every evil that he perpetrated, he will wish there were a great distance between him and that evil (or that Day). Allah warns you to fear (the wrath) of His divine essence, and Allah is Most Compassionate towards His servants.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:31: (O Beloved!) Say: ‘If you love Allah, follow me. Allah will then take you as (His) beloved, and forgive you your sins for you, and Allah is Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:32: Say: ‘Obey Allah and the Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him).’ But if they turn away, then Allah does not like the disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:33: Verily, Allah chose Adam, and Nuh (Noah), and the family of Ibrahim (Abraham) and the family of ‘Imran (in dignity) above all the people of the world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:34: They are all one race, descendants of one another. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:35: And (recall) when the wife of ‘Imran said: ‘O my Lord, I vow purely to You what is in my womb, freeing him (from other obligations). So, accept (this offering) from me. You are indeed All-Hearing, All-Knowing.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:36: So when she delivered a baby girl, she submitted: ‘Lord, I have given birth but to a female child.’ But Allah knew best what she had given birth to. (She said:) ‘And the boy (that I prayed for) could never (be) like the girl (that Allah has blessed me with); and I have named her Maryam (Mary, the worshipper); and, surely, I commit her and her children to Your protection against (the mischief of) Satan, the outcast.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:37: So, her Lord graciously accepted her (Maryam [Mary]) with excellent acceptance and brought her up immaculately and entrusted her guardianship to Zakariyya (Zacharias). Every time Zakariyya (Zacharias) entered her chamber of worship, he found with her (novel and uncommon) food items. He inquired: ‘O Maryam, wherefrom have these things come for you?’ She replied: ‘This (sustenance) comes from Allah. Verily, Allah provides sustenance without measure to whom He wills.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:38: At the same place, Zakariyya (Zacharias) supplicated his Lord. He submitted: ‘O my Lord, bless me, out of Your Grace, with a virtuous and pure offspring. Surely, You alone hear the supplication.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:39: Whilst he was still standing in the chamber offering the Prayer (or supplicating), the angels called out to him: ‘Indeed, Allah gives you the good news of (a son) Yahya (John), who shall confirm Allah’s Word (i.e., ‘Isa [Jesus]), and he will be a leader, well-protected against (temptation for) women, and a Prophet from amongst (Our) exceptionally pious servants.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:40: (Zakariyya [Zacharias]) submitted: ‘O my Lord, how shall I have a son when old age has already overtaken me, and my wife is (also) barren?’ He said: ‘The same way as Allah does whatever He wills.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:41: Zakariyya (Zacharias) submitted: ‘O my Lord, fix a sign for me.’ Allah said: ‘The sign for you is that for three days you will not be able to communicate to the people except by gestures. And remember your Lord abundantly and glorify Him persistently, evening and morning.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:42: And (remember) when the angels said: ‘O Maryam (Mary), surely Allah has chosen you and has blessed you with purity and has exalted you today over all the women of the world.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:43: O Maryam (Mary)! Obey your Lord consistently with utmost humbleness, prostrate yourself, and bow down in worship along with those who bow down.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:44: (O Beloved!) These are the tidings of the unseen which We reveal to you. But (at that time) you were not present with them when they were casting their pens (by way of a draw to determine) which of them should take care of Maryam (Mary). Nor were you with them when they were disputing with one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:45: When the angels said: ‘O Maryam (Mary), surely, Allah gives you glad tidings of a (particular) Word from Him named the Messiah, ‘Isa, the son of Maryam (Jesus, the son of Mary), who would be eminent and exalted, (both) in this world and in the Hereafter, and would be of those who are exceptionally intimate servants of Allah blessed with His nearness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:46: And he will talk to the people (alike) both in the cradle and in ripe years, and he will be one of the most pious servants (of Allah).’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:47: Maryam (Mary) submitted: ‘O my Lord, how shall I have a son when no man has ever touched me?’ He said: ‘Just as Allah creates what He pleases.’ When He decides (to do) some work, He just gives it the command ‘Be,’ and it becomes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:48: And Allah will teach him the Book and the wisdom, the Torah and the Injil ([the Gospel] everything).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:49: And he will be a Messenger to the Children of Israel, (saying to them:) ‘I have undoubtedly brought to you a sign from your Lord: I design for you from clay (a figure) like the shape of a bird; then I breathe into it; and at once it becomes a flying bird by Allah’s command. And I restore health to the born blind, and the lepers, and raise the dead to life by the command of Allah. And I inform you of (all) what you have eaten, and what you have hoarded in your houses. Truly, there is a sign in it for you if you believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:50: And I validate the (Book) Torah sent down before me, and that is because I may declare certain things lawful for you which were forbidden to you as unlawful. And I have come to you from your Lord with a sign. So, fear Allah and obey me.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 3:51: Verily, Allah is my Lord and your Lord too. So worship Him alone. This is the straight path.’
